regulation_text: The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) requires employers to pay non-exempt employees at least the federal minimum wage of $7.25 per hour.
atom_rules: Pay non-exempt employees at least $7.25 per hour.

regulation_text: Under the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), eligible employees are entitled to take up to 12 weeks of unpaid, job-protected leave for family and medical reasons.
atom_rules: Provide up to 12 weeks of unpaid leave for eligible employees.

regulation_text: The Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) requires employers to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities, unless it causes undue hardship.
atom_rules: Provide reasonable accommodations unless it causes undue hardship.

regulation_text: Employers must maintain records of hours worked each day and total hours worked each week for all non-exempt employees as required by the FLSA.
atom_rules: Record daily and weekly work hours for all non-exempt employees.

regulation_text: Employers are required to provide employees with a written notice detailing their rights under the Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA).
atom_rules: Provide written notice of rights under the EPPA.

regulation_text: OSHA mandates that employers must keep the workplace free from serious recognized hazards and comply with standards, rules, and regulations issued under the OSH Act.
atom_rules: Ensure workplace is free from serious hazards.

regulation_text: According to the Equal Pay Act, employers must pay men and women equally for performing the same work in the same workplace.
atom_rules: Ensure equal pay for equal work regardless of gender.
